title: Drawing, Gateway for prison erected by Pope Pius VI
title_raw: Gateway for prison erected by Pope Pius VI
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, red ink
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457e)
inscribed: Inscribed on pedestal: PIVS VI PM / FECIT A MDCCL...
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Only a part of the right half is shown. Broad, low, arched door opening. A pilaster decorated with diamond shapes supports teh entablature, over which a pedestal rises with the Papal coat of arms. Colored background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Gateway for prison erected by Pope Pius VI. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, red ink. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1089
